title: Love Island Australia fans go into meltdown over newcomer Eoghan
text:
Some Love Island Australia viewers were left feeling short-changed after the first five men were introduced on Monday night's episode.

But by the end of the season premiere, their prayers had seemingly been answered by handsome Irishman Eoghan Murphy.

Fans immediately took to Twitter, praising the newcomer as a 'manly man' in contrast to the show's other 'pretty boys'.

'Where do I find one?' Love Island Australia fans went into a meltdown over newcomer Eoghan Murphy (pictured) during Monday night's season premiere

'Now Eoghan just looks like a manly man. His eyes... oh my god, where do I find one? And he mentions watching Disney movies - stop!' one viewer tweeted.

Another fan wrote: 'Watch out, boys! Here comes Eoghan!'

Several Twitter users were impressed with Eoghan's confidence, after he stripped off during a game of truth or dare with the other contestants.

Swooning: Fans immediately took to Twitter, praising the intruder as a 'manly man' in contrast to the show's other 'pretty boys'

Warning: One Love Island viewer said the five other men were no competition for Eoghan

Dare to bare! Several Twitter users were impressed with Eoghan's confidence, after he stripped off during a game of truth or dare with the other contestants

The 23-year-old sent shockwaves through the villa when he was introduced on Monday as the first intruder of the season.

He didn't waste time with pleasantries, going straight in to kiss Vanessa Sierra and Cartier Surjan during the truth or dare challenge.

Upon his arrival at the Fijian villa, the real estate agent said he was 'not there to make friends'.

Here comes trouble! Eoghan, 23, sent shockwaves through the villa when he was introduced on Monday as the first intruder of the season

Wow! Eoghan didn't waste time with pleasantries, going straight in to kiss Vanessa Sierra and Cartier Surjan during the truth or dare challenge

'If I like someone, I'm going for it 100 per cent. I'm not here to make friends. I have enough friends, I want a girl,' he said.

'You are a bunch of boys, the man is here. Come on!'

Love Island Australia continues Tuesday at 8:40pm on Channel Nine
description: Some Love Island Australia viewers were left feeling short-changed after the first five men were introduced on Monday night's episode.
authors: David Wu For Daily Mail Australia
